title: Understanding Re-traumatization
text: Re-traumatization occurs when an individual feels as though they are reliving a past traumatic event. This can happen when they encounter situations or triggers that remind them of the original trauma.

title: Identifying Triggers
text: Triggers can be anything that reminds a person of their trauma, such as certain sounds, smells, or situations. Recognizing these triggers is crucial in understanding re-traumatization.

hintAnswer: feeling like the past trauma is reoccurring or that the person is in an unsafe situation as they were when the trauma occurred
title: Defining Re-traumatization
text: Re-traumatization is when a person feels like the past trauma is reoccurring or that they are in an unsafe situation similar to when the trauma originally occurred.
choices: feeling like the past trauma is reoccurring or that the person is in an unsafe situation as they were when the trauma occurred
when an individual is exposed over time to multiple recurring traumatic events (Cenat, 2022). This type of trauma can be sexual, physical, or psychological in nature.
helps people face and control their fear by gradually exposing them to the trauma they experienced in a safe way
